fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.dpp.withPlugins.plugins

Class EmitterPlugin

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPlugin
      • fr.sorbonne_u.components.examples.dpp.withPlugins.plugins.EmitterPlugin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginI, java.io.Serializable

    public class EmitterPlugin
extends AbstractPlugin
    The class EmitterPlugin implements the functionalities that are required by components that act as data sources in the data processing pipeline.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant       true

    Created on : 2022-06-03

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class fr.sorbonne_u.components.AbstractPlugin

        AbstractPlugin.FakeComponent

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String nextProcessingComponentInboundPortURI
      URI of the inbound port of the first processing componenet in the data processing pipeline.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      protected TransmissionOutBoundPort transmissionOutboundPort
      outbound port used to transmit data pieces to the first component in a data processing pipeline.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EmitterPlugin()
      create the plug-in.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      connect the outbound port of this plug-in to the inbound port of the next component in the data processing pipeline; this connection cannot be done within usual plug-in life-cycle methods as we can't know when the corresponding plug-in in the next component will be ready.
      void finalise()
      finalise the plug-in at least when the owner component is finalised.
      void initialise()
      initialise the plug-in by adding to the owner component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in; subclasses should add any other initialisation necessary to make the plug-in work in the context of its owner.
      void installOn(ComponentI owner)
      initialise the plug-in reference to its owner component and add to the component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in.
      void setNextInboundPortURI(java.lang.String nextTransmissionInboundPortURI)
      initialise the URI of the inbound port of the first component in the data processing pipeline; this method is useful to avoid changing the constructor and thus maintain the same creation protocol for all plug-ins; it must be called before trying to connect to the next component, indeed.
      void transmit(PipelineDataI d)
      transmit a piece of data to the next component in the data processing pipeline.
      void uninstall()
      uninstall the plug-in from its owner component.

      • installOn

        public void installOn(ComponentI owner)
               throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: PluginI
        initialise the plug-in reference to its owner component and add to the component every specific information, ports, etc. required to run the plug-in.

        Contract

         pre     owner != null
 pre     getPluginURI() != null
 pre     !owner.isInstalled(getPluginURI())
 pre     getPreferredExecutionServiceURI() == null || owner.validExecutorServiceURI(getPreferredExecutionServiceURI())
 post    owner == getOwner()
 post    getPreferredExecutionServiceURI() == null || getPreferredExecutionServiceIndex() == ((AbstractComponent)owner).getExecutorServiceIndex(getPreferredExecutionServiceURI())
        Specified by:
        installOn in interface PluginI
        Overrides:
        installOn in class AbstractPlugin
        Parameters:
        owner - component on which the plug-in must be installed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • setNextInboundPortURI

        public void setNextInboundPortURI(java.lang.String nextTransmissionInboundPortURI)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        initialise the URI of the inbound port of the first component in the data processing pipeline; this method is useful to avoid changing the constructor and thus maintain the same creation protocol for all plug-ins; it must be called before trying to connect to the next component, indeed.

        Contract

         pre     nextTransmissionInboundPortURI != null
 pre     !nextTransmissionInboundPortURI.isEmpty()
 post   true                    // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        nextTransmissionInboundPortURI - URI of the inbound port of the first processing componenet in the data processing pipeline.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
